The photographic discs 
of all stars when viewed on 
the negatives under a high 
magnifying power have a 
dark or black centre grad-
ually shading off to invisibility,
and when measuring them 
micrometrically it is always 
somewhat uncertain where 
to fix the boundary of either 
the dark centre or the 
the shading. The following 
table is the result of careful 
measurements by micrometer,
with magnifying power 
of about 100 diameters.
